name: TownCraft
description: TownCraft is a chill-out crafting and city-building game. Instead of just surviving, you must turn your empty plot of land and its rarely-used road into a bustling town full of shops, workers and taverns.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 Processor: Intel Core Duo 2.0Ghz+ Memory: 512 MB RAM Graphics: 512mb Graphics Card Storage: 150 MB available space
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 7 Processor: Intel Core i5+ Memory: 1 GB RAM Graphics: 512mb Graphics Card Storage: 200 MB available space

reviews.review_text: One of the best games i've ever played, when i got it i easily spent the whole day playing it...couldn't...wouldn't...shouldn't stop....
More like minecraft . But's need to change some mechanics in the game.

I like playing games... any kind of games. you dont rly need to play the tutorial to start a new world... I didnt. I saw the man standing there and thought:'Hey little guy, what can i do in this game?' I clicked on a tree and the game gave me stick... A stick? 'Where is the wood?' I thought. Instead of clicking a tree, i clicked on a pile of stones. It gave me a little stone. I saw an icon on the right... It was the crafting menu. I thought:' Hey, can't i make an axe out of that?'.   First of: I like this game. The idea of building a big town, offer jobs to get materials faster, Selling things you dont need to buy things you need, being a farmer and grow crops...  There are a few bugs of course (2..) but not not really bad ones... Its not crashing, not lagging ,no nothing. Just a game with a lot of potential... Great job guys ! PS: The game just came out on steam so dont cry please, it will be fixed soon ! (I think ;D)

I bought this game back when it still had the Early Access on it, played it, it was kind of crappy but it was still in development so alright. I come to check it out now to see it's been 100% abandoned. Save your money, it's not worth $10.
Feels like it should be a browser game. Think FarmVille, without the polish and less stuff or indeed any incentive to bother - it gets real old real fast, but at least there's no paywall...
Many things make this game crash. It's quite frustrating.

You could buy it out and try it  Pros: Achievements Cards Building up Quests Collections Crafting  Cons: Bugs that were never fixed -> quick crashes and stop gameplay types. Avatar can't be modified strangely questee never stayed around to for you finish the quest?? -> help others finish your quests recommend placing your stockpile near the road with torch nearby. There are no mobs that attack you I don't really see path recipe in future help hinder tree growth.  Avatar or your character never sleeps, eats or passes out.   Music 7/10 Game play mechanics basing it on tutorial that was fun the secondary needs work. 1) 9/10 and 2) 4/10 secondary story got harder to work on, because income making was important really they should cover that in tutorial.
